name: NSAnimation.Curve
desc: These constants describe the curve of an animationâ€”that is, the relative speed of an animation from start to finish.

items.name: case easeInOut
items.desc: Describes an S-curve in which the animation slowly speeds up and then slows down near the end of the animation. This constant is the default.

items.name: case easeIn
items.desc: Describes an animation that slows down as it reaches the end.

items.name: case easeOut
items.desc: Describes an animation that slowly speeds up from the start.

items.name: case linear
items.desc: Describes an animation in which there is no change in frame rate.
